heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 21 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 10th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 6 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 18 October 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (199°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.9°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 239 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm), cloud levels (up 519 m), and light levels (up 2845 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 239.0m lower than yesterday, 206.8m lower than the past week, 518.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 706m and a peak of 2390m, averaging 916.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and near calm conditions. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
